flow.descriptionCdata:
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.1494bb65-f3e9-4fa1-9413-07bc0bd66465.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.259e7fa3-3dfa-41b5-9d53-083604831a74.description=
Service to validate an XML document. Input must be given for either "xmlDocument" or for "xmlLocation". The "'xsdLocation" input is optional, but if specified then the XML document will be validated against the XSD schema.

Inputs\: 
    xmlDocument - The contents of a XML document as a string.
    xmlLocation  - A fully qualified URL to a HTTP-accessible XML document (i.e WSDL) or the complete path to a local XML document.
    xsdLocation   - A fully qualified URL to a HTTP-accessible XSD schema document or the complete path to a local XSD schema document to validate the XML against.  The XSD schema document must be a World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Schema, sometimes referred to as WXS.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false
    username - The name of the user used to connect to the  in case it is a fully qualified URL and authentication is needed. If no username is specified, then anonymous authentication will be attempted.
    password - The password for the user specified by .
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL/TSL. A certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    keystore - The pathname of the Java KeyStore file. You only need this if the server requires client authentication. If the protocol (specified by the 'url') is not 'https' or if trustAllRoots is 'true' this input is ignored.
Default value\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
Format\: Java KeyStore (JKS)
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and keystore is empty, keystorePassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    trustKeystore - The pathname of the Java TrustStore file. This contains certificates from other parties that you expect to communicate with, or from Certificate Authorities that you trust to identify other parties.  If the protocol (specified by the 'url') is not 'https' or if trustAllRoots is 'true' this input is ignored.
Default value\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
Format\: Java KeyStore (JKS)
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and trustKeystore is empty, trustPassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    x509HostnameVerifier - Specifies the way the server hostname must match a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate. The hostname verification system prevents communication with other hosts other than the ones you intended. This is done by checking that the hostname is in the subject alternative name extension of the certificate. This system is designed to ensure that, if an attacker(Man In The Middle) redirects traffic to his machine, the client will not accept the connection. If you set this input to "allow_all", this verification is ignored and you become vulnerable to security attacks. For the value "browser_compatible" the hostname verifier works the same way as Curl and Firefox. The hostname must match either the first CN, or any of the subject-alts. A wildcard can occur in the CN, and in any of the subject-alts. The only difference between "browser_compatible" and "strict" is that a wildcard (such as "*.foo.com") with "browser_compatible" matches all subdomains, including "a.b.foo.com". From the security perspective, to provide protection against possible Man-In-The-Middle attacks, we strongly recommend to use "strict" option.
Default value\: strict
Valid values\: strict, browser_compatible, allow_all
    proxyHost - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port. Default value\: 8080. Valid values\: -1, and positive integer values. When the value is '-1' the default port of the scheme, specified in the 'proxyHost', will be used.
    proxyUsername - The user name used when connecting to the proxy. The 'authType' input will be used to choose authentication type. The 'Basic' and 'Digest' proxy auth type are supported.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the proxyUsername input value.
    
Responses\:
    valid xml document - A valid XML document was found.
    invalid xml document - Invalid XML document was found.
    xml document not found - XML document was not found at the given location.
    failure - General failure while trying to retrieve an XML document or XSD document if specified.
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.2cbc2ae0-ae42-4823-87c2-6cddf352d736.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.3b48db31-c2cc-4c54-a6c5-5c61ffdec09b.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.5588e63a-4ee8-490d-8cfa-dc5db3292b05.description=
This operation writes the data from "contents" input to the requested file. The operation can be used to overwrite existing content of the file, append extra lines to it or even create a new file.

Inputs\:
    source -  Full path to file. If the file does not exist it is created first.
    contents - The content that should be written to the file. This input field can contain more lines, separated by a delimiter. If it contains the new line character (\n or \r\n), but this is not the delimiter, this character will be escaped and written to file.  
Example\: "This is line no. 01\nThis is line no. 2\n" where \n is the delimiter.
    delimiter - Specifies the newline delimiter that is used to split the "contents" input field into separate lines that will be further written to the given file.
Examples\: \n, \r\n, etc
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write to the file. 
Default\: UTF-8. 
Valid values\: windows-1252, UTF-16, UTF-16BE,  ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII, Shift_JIS etc.
    overwrite - Specifies whether to overwrite the file or append to it. 
Default\: true. 
Valid values\: true, false or the empty string. If this is left empty, the file will be overwritten.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the "success" confirmation message if the operation successfully completes, or an exception message otherwise.
    returnCode - It has the value 0 if the operation successfully completes and 1 otherwise.
    exception - This contains an exception message if the operation fails.

Responses\:
    success - File/directory was written successfully.
    failure - Unable to write to file/directory, empty contents or source.

Examples\:
1. This is a valid input example for using this operation on Windows\:
    source\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
    contents\: line1,line2,line3
    delimiter\: ,

2. This is a valid input example for using this operation on Linux\:
    source\: /root/example.txt
    contents\: line1,line2,line3
    delimiter\: ,
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.8369a44a-d89e-4d76-8808-256712b7bab8.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML file and runs the specified XPath query against the XML read from the file. It returns the results in a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    filename - Absolute path of the XML file to be opened on the RAS.
Example\: c\:\directory\file.xml (Windows RAS)
/directory/file.xml (Non-Windows RAS)
    xpathQuery - The XPath query to be run. See the examples in Notes section below.
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list. 
Default value\: ','.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Results\:
   returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the results in a form of a delimited list. If multiple XPaths are defined, the delimiter is added between each value. There is no final delimiter.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. The XPath query can be specified as a single query. For example\:
/employees/employee[@id\="3"]/*[name()\="name" or name()\="jobDescription" or name()\="salary" or name()\="managerId"]/text()

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Goofy,tester,$50,1

2. If more than one XPath query needs to be specified, populate xpathQuery using the XPath concat function. For example\:
concat(/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/name/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/jobDescription/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/managerId/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/salary/text())

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Donald Duck,Lead Coder,1,$50

The examples above use the following xml file located on the RAS containing the content below\:


  
    Mickey Mouse
    Chief
    $100
    
  
  
    Donald Duck
    Lead Coder
    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy
    tester
    $50
    1
  
  
    Pluto
    Coder - grade 1
    $25
    2
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.9b228414-ffc9-4fda-8ce8-0071685e1973.description=

Displays a message to the user.

Inputs\:
  message - The message text to display
  title - The title on the message window. Defaults to "Status message".

Responses\:
  Always returns success.

Examples\:
  In order to display the message "Finished" to the user, go to the 
  detail screen for the input named "message" and change the Otherwise option
  from Prompt User to Use Constant.  Then enter the text "Finished" into the
  Constant Value field.

  References to flow variables in the Contant Value field are expanded so that
  the text may be dynamic.  Flow variable references are of the form
  ${variable}.  For example, the text\:
     ${count} systems were modified 
  could be used to display a message about the number of systems that were
  repaired, whose value is in the flow variable "count".

  When the message is displayed, it will properly render any embedded html
  tags, which permits creating messages with more advanced formatting.  For 
  example to display a message in italics you could use\:
    This is important
  or to display a message in red\:
    This is really  important

  You can create messages that contain multiple lines by entering a multiple
  line message in the Constant Value field, or by using HTML 
 tags for line
  breaks.  Note that \n characters are displayed literally and are not used for
  creating multiple lines.
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.a61ef1b3-23d8-4c85-89e6-8648c45134ba.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML file and runs the specified XPath query against the XML read from the file. It returns the results in a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    filename - Absolute path of the XML file to be opened on the RAS.
Example\: c\:\directory\file.xml (Windows RAS)
/directory/file.xml (Non-Windows RAS)
    xpathQuery - The XPath query to be run. See the examples in Notes section below.
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list. 
Default value\: ','.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Results\:
   returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the results in a form of a delimited list. If multiple XPaths are defined, the delimiter is added between each value. There is no final delimiter.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. The XPath query can be specified as a single query. For example\:
/employees/employee[@id\="3"]/*[name()\="name" or name()\="jobDescription" or name()\="salary" or name()\="managerId"]/text()

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Goofy,tester,$50,1

2. If more than one XPath query needs to be specified, populate xpathQuery using the XPath concat function. For example\:
concat(/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/name/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/jobDescription/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/managerId/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/salary/text())

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Donald Duck,Lead Coder,1,$50

The examples above use the following xml file located on the RAS containing the content below\:


  
    Mickey Mouse
    Chief
    $100
    
  
  
    Donald Duck
    Lead Coder
    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy
    tester
    $50
    1
  
  
    Pluto
    Coder - grade 1
    $25
    2
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.b6a95564-ab1a-452c-9696-c49a3ea378aa.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.c367332e-2ea5-4e43-a7d3-65011b5eb145.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML file and runs the specified XPath query against the XML read from the file. It returns the results in a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    filename - Absolute path of the XML file to be opened on the RAS.
Example\: c\:\directory\file.xml (Windows RAS)
/directory/file.xml (Non-Windows RAS)

    delimiter - The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list. 
Default value\: ','.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities.

Donald Duck,Lead Coder,1,$50

The examples above use the following xml file located on the RAS containing the content below\:

    Chief
    $100
    
  
  
    Donald Duck
    Lead Coder
    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy
    tester
    $50
    1
  
  
    Pluto
    Coder - grade 1
    $25
    2
c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.c71ab87f-df7b-42d6-a9d6-de9dac9f1ce0.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML file and runs the specified XPath query against the XML read from the file. It returns the results in a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    filename - Absolute path of the XML file to be opened on the RAS.
Example\: c\:\directory\file.xml (Windows RAS)
/directory/file.xml (Non-Windows RAS)
    xpathQuery - The XPath query to be run. See the examples in Notes section below.
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list.

http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true

http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities.

Results\:
   returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the results in a form of a delimited list. If multiple XPaths are defined, the delimiter is added between each value. There is no final delimiter.

/employees/employee[@id\="3"]/*[name()\="name" or name()\="jobDescription" or name()\="salary" or name()\="managerId"]/text()

concat(/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/name/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/jobDescription/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/managerId/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/salary/text())

    $100

    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy

c5631374-d438-4d38-9244-db5f9421dafc.f9f9cdca-6d0b-4cbf-8495-140422e69318.description=
Creates (recursively or not) a directory.

Input Parameters\:
path - The path of the directory to create.

Responses\:
success - Directory Created.
failure - Something went wrong.
